channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats condemn ICE after five-year-old detained with father in US raid
item.description: Liam Ramos, of Minnesota, was detained with his father and flown to Texas, prompting Democrats to accuse ICE of cruelty ICE detains five-year-old Minn...

item.title: News live: Sussan Ley says her leadership can survive Coalition split; Australian actors among Oscar nominees
item.description: Follow updates live Liberal senator says party still ‘believes’ in the Coalition Anne Ruston, a Liberal senator, said the party still believes in the ...

item.title: Three people dead and alleged gunman at large after shooting in NSW town
item.description: Two women and a man have died after an alleged shooting at Lake Cargelligo as police urge locals to stay inside Follow our Australia news live blog fo...

item.title: Powerful winter storm to bring heavy snow across much of US this weekend
item.description: Storm expected to hit from south Rockies and plains into mid-south on Friday before spreading east A powerful winter storm is set to sweep across much...

item.title: Macron says Europe’s unity worked against Trump’s threats as EU leaders hold emergency summit – latest updates
item.description: EU meeting in Brussels is aimed at discussing volatile situation with US in wake of Trump’s recent moves around Greenland Zelenskyy’s speech looks to ...

item.title: Trump's son called UK police after seeing woman 'beat up', court hears
item.description: President Trump's youngest son told officers in London he had seen a friend being attacked during a video call.

item.title: Trump sues JPMorgan for $5bn over account closure after Capitol riot
item.description: JPMorgan Chase the lawsuit has "no merit" and the bank "does not close accounts for political or religious reasons".

item.title: Chisora to fight Wilder in London in April
item.description: Derek Chisora will face former heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder in London in April in the Briton's 50th career fight.

item.title: Minister told armoured vehicle which left soldiers vomiting was 'safe'
item.description: The defence minister claims he wasn't made fully aware of issues which led to 35 people falling ill.

item.title: Hamnet writer Maggie O'Farrell says Oscar nod 'very surreal'
item.description: Hamnet, based on the novel written by Coleraine-born Maggie O'Farrell, picks up eight Oscar nominations.
